Articles.Content:
Hi, 

I think that it would be very nice to have an option in the difficulty setting to add commnet delay. For example, when you have a rover on the moon and you press w to go forward it would take 1.5 secs to react, and amplify the effect by the distance from a command pod or the KSC. Also, antenna power would not change the delay.
I call that input lag and it's irritating even at 0.5s, not to mention more.

14 hours ago, The Aziz said:

I call that input lag and it's irritating even at 0.5s, not to mention more.

He said optional so if someone doesn't like it they can simply turn it off

I like the idea aslong as it remains an optional setting.And hey we finally got reasons to add relays

On 7/15/2019 at 12:40 PM, Tornado77 said:

Hi, 

I think that it would be very nice to have an option in the difficulty setting to add commnet delay. For example, when you have a rover on the moon and you press w to go forward it would take 1.5 secs to react, and amplify the effect by the distance from a command pod or the KSC. Also, antenna power would not change the delay.

Try to land on Tylo by hand with such delay...

2 minutes ago, TheFlyingKerman said:

Try to land on Tylo by hand with such delay...

If there would be a base or a station with kerbals in it near the probe it would reduce the delay because the probe would be controlled from the base
And that would pretty much defeat the point of sending probes because you always need somebody nearby.

In real life we should send people to Saturn for this very reason when we send the atmospheric flyer.  I volunteer.  I'll swing by Mars on the way to give the rovers a gee up.

I don't want to go to Jupiter.   Nasty rads there.  Saturn is much more pleasant.

kOS becomes a must when using mods like Signal Delay.  But also it encourages a crewed presence though just so you don't have to deal with that unfortunate lag feel.

Peace.
Anyway, the Kerbol system is much smaller than our solar system, so the delay would not be so huge

Yes, I can see this as an interesting (toggleable) option....

Time delay in proportion to distance from the 'pilot in control' makes some sense.
